article.headline: Lafayette 78, Holy Cross 72
article.story: EASTON, Pa. (AP) -- Justin DeBerry scored 16 to lead Lafayette to a 78-72 win over Holy Cross on Saturday. Lafayette (18-5, 9-1 Patriot League) improved to 11-0 at home this season. Holy Cross (10-13, 4-6) was led by John Hurley's 13 points. Kevin Hamilton, Jave Meade and Keith Simmons each had 11. Holy Cross led at the half 35-32 and took a nine point lead at the 14:21 mark of the second half. But Lafayette went on a 12-2 run, punctuated by back-to-back 3s by DeBerry, to take a 51-49 lead. The score was tied 60-60 with 5:31 to go, but Lafayette took advantage of several missed shots by Holy Cross to pull ahead for the win. Rob Dill and Sean Knitter each scored 14 for Lafayette.
